Html:
I'm trying to capture volume meter levels for a microphone, but am unable to unless I go to the "Recording devices" panel in Windows. Once that panel is open, I can view the levels fine via my application. As soon as the panel is closed, I am unable to view the meter levels. The device state is set to "Active" as well.
I'm not sure if the device is automatically disabled when it's not "activated" or "called" from an application. Is there anyway that I can programmatically enable it? Or maybe I'm missing something?

I access the levels via the normal method:
DevCol[cmbDevices.SelectedIndex].AudioMeterInformation.MasterPeakValue;

Any help would be much appreciated.
I'm afraid I don't know the answer to this. Probably best to see if you can find an answer on MSDN in the WASAPI documentation.

Alright, thanks anyways.
By the way, really nice job you've done on NAudio. Keep up the good work.
